meanings.definition: Feeling or showing a lack of interest or enthusiasm
meanings.sent1: She looked jadedly at the boring movie playing on TV.
meanings.sent2: The students listened jadedly to the long lecture.
meanings.sent3: Even the energetic puppy seemed jadedly after a day of playing.
meanings.sent4: His jadedly expression mirrored his disinterest in the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The jadedly response from the audience indicated their lack of excitement.

meanings.definition: In a bored or cynical manner
meanings.sent1: He sighed jadedly as he scrolled through his social media feed.
meanings.sent2: She jadedly remarked on the predictability of the plot.
meanings.sent3: The comedian jadedly delivered his jokes to the unresponsive crowd.
meanings.sent4: The artist jadedly painted yet another sunset, lacking inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The detective jadedly surveyed the crime scene, expecting the worst.
